text:
How do I replace all the values of a dataframe column to a substring of the current values?
For example, my column's title is Name and I'd like to only keep the last five numbers. In the first row below that would be just `52000`

 `Name`
`TSLAL042052000.U`
`TSLAL042062000.U`


`replace!(df.Name, ?????? ) => [10:15])`
This is my current incomplete attempt. I'm guessing I'm close but I can't figure out how to reference the values

text: Ref here is to prevent broadcasting from also iterating over the range

elements.text: Ref here is to prevent broadcasting from also iterating over the range

text: Note that there can be issues with indexing strings in this way, depending on the encoding and whether there are special characters in there - this has never mattered for me in practice but check that your result is as expected and if something's off have a look around Discourse for string indexing

elements.text: Note that there can be issues with indexing strings in this way, depending on the encoding and whether there are special characters in there - this has never mattered for me in practice but check that your result is as expected and if something's off have a look around Discourse for string indexing

text: or `chop.(df.Names, head=9, tail=2)` which uses character counts
